Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can include a variety of plants and animals in their drawing, such as trees, bushes, fish, and insects, to show the diversity of life in a habitat.
The student can accurately depict specific examples of both land habitats (e.g., garden, forest) and water habitats (e.g., pond, stream).
The student can label most of the different types of living things, although a few labels may be missing or slightly incorrect.
The student can attempt to compare two habitats using their drawing, indicating some differences in plant and animal types.
CANNOT: The student may not fully recognize or clearly illustrate all patterns of diversity in habitats and might overlook certain animals or plants of less obvious significance (e.g., microorganisms).
Some labels or details might be incomplete or mislabeled, leading to minor inaccuracies (e.g., confusing certain plant species).
